derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'steadfast'): via Old French from Latin durabilis, from durare 'to last' (see duration)

entry.def: Something that is durable is strong and lasts a long time without breaking or becoming weaker.

example.ex: Bone china is strong and durable.

sentences.sentence: "less durable rocks were gradually worn away to form valleys"
"the perdurable granite of the ancient Appalachian spine of the continent"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dour=dur心硬不为所动→adj.冷酷的,严厉的
dur持久,延续,坚硬+able……的→adj.持久的,耐久的
ob加强+dur持久,延续,坚硬+ate……的→加强硬→顽固
dur持久,延续,坚硬+ation表名词→n.持久;期间;持续时间
dur持久,延续,坚硬+ess表名词或动词→硬压→强迫
endure[v.忍受,持久,持续]+ance表名词→n.忍耐[力],持久[力],耐久[性]

stems_affixes.value_cn: 在……的期间, 在……的时候
stems_affixes.word_buile: dur延续+ing状态→prep.在……的期间, 在……的时候
in进入+dur持久,延续,坚硬+ate使……→使成为坚硬
per贯穿+dur持久+e→v.持久, 继续
